code:
def check_inventory_superset(full_inventory, partial_inventory):
    """
    This function checks if the full inventory is a superset of the partial inventory.
    It means that the full inventory should contain all items and possibly more
    compared to the partial inventory.
    """
    return full_inventory.issuperset(partial_inventory)

def display_inventory_items(inventory):
    """
    This function prints out the items in the inventory along with their quantities.
    """
    for item, quantity in inventory.items():
        print(f"Item: {item}, Quantity: {quantity}")

# Example inventories
full_inventory = {'apples': 50, 'bananas': 30, 'oranges': 20}
partial_inventory = {'apples': 20, 'bananas': 15}

# Convert inventory dictionaries to sets
full_inventory_set = set(full_inventory)
partial_inventory_set = set(partial_inventory)

# Check if the full inventory is a superset of the partial inventory
inventory_check = check_inventory_superset(full_inventory_set, partial_inventory_set)

print("Full inventory contains all items from partial inventory:", inventory_check)

# Display the items in the full inventory
display_inventory_items(full_inventory)
